name: Death Metal Bardbarian: Barbarian 16 / Blackguard 4 / Bard 20
author: EasternPromises

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Good evening metal fans,

This is the graduated form of my build review post. I ended up taking another level of BG for DS per Valerfor's recommendation to make it more general to "standard" magic environments. Also sneak attack.

Terrifying Rage, Taunt, UMD, Spellcraft, Tumble, LI+Epic Bard Song, Dark Blessing, and Divine Might/Divine shield. You'll have no issues hitting the STR cap with rage so PUMP YOUR CHARISMA. It boosts saves, damage, and your FEAR FACTOR. Conscience not needed, alignment restrictions apply. I would use a scimitar and tower but it works nicely with anything.

Without further adieu, here is the Death Metal Bardbarian:

posts.content:
Thanks Valerfor.

I have another version for your consideration. I don't know how I missed the greataxe/guitar idea the first time.

Given that this build is all about buffing yourself and lowing your opponent's resistances, I built a version more heavily focused around combat manuevers. Lowering your target's concentration and discipline is no joke when the very next action sends their weapon flying. I've been practicing with taunt+combat cancel on the EE version and it's been working great.

AB is an acceptable 41 but there's just no room in epic for GS.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I do prefer the first version I think, although I saw what you did here.
The reason is simply that your bard song is capped at 50 ranks and you are over-exceeding this without even considering gear,
that's why I think that having two more Gr. strength is better although your AB stayed the same.
Also, your saves in the second version are slightly worse for some reason.

Oh, and an AB of 41 is more than "Acceptable" if we are talking about an epic Bard,
simply by singing/cursing, you have raised this by 7,
but I am sure you already know this stuff ;)

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
The second version doesn't have BG, freeing up for combat maneuvering. I agree the first is more well rounded, I'm just banging my head against the wall trying to get ALL the synergy.

Thanks for the feedback!
